name: Daal Baati Churma
description: A traditional Rajasthani dish featuring baked wheat balls (baati) served with spicy, flavorful mixed lentil curry (daal) and sweet churma. It is hearty, rich, and best enjoyed with ghee.
preCookingProcess: Combine whole wheat flour, salt, and 2 tbsp ghee in a large bowl.
Add water gradually to make a stiff dough.
Shape the dough into small round balls (baatis).
Preheat oven or tandoor to medium heat.

Prepare the baatis: Place the baatis on a baking tray and bake at 180°C for 20–25 minutes until golden brown from all sides.
Once done, dip the hot baatis in melted ghee for rich flavor and moisture.
Cook the dal: Rinse and pressure cook chana dal, toor dal, and moong dal with 3 cups water, turmeric, and salt until soft.
In another pan, heat 2 tbsp ghee and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onion, ginger garlic paste, and sauté until golden brown.
Mix in tomatoes, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the oil separates.
Add the cooked dal to this mixture and simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Prepare churma (optional): Crumble one or two baked baatis, add 1 tbsp ghee and 1 tbsp sugar, mix well to make churma.
Combine and finish: Serve baatis warm with hot dal poured on top.
Drizzle with more ghee and serve with churma on the side.

postCookingProcess: Taste and adjust salt or spice if needed.
Garnish dal with chopped coriander leaves and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve piping hot for the authentic Rajasthani experience.
tipsAndTricks: Roast baatis evenly for crisp outer texture.
Use a mix of dals to get balanced flavor.
Add hot ghee just before serving for best aroma.
